snippet: Shares of Apple Inc rose 1 percent on Thursday after German supplier Dialog Semiconductor Plc said its quarterly revenue were higher than expected, adding to recent enthusiasm about demand for the newest iPhone.

headline.main: Apple Shares Perk Up After Strong Report From iPhone Chip Supplier
headline.print_headline: Apple Shares Perk Up After Strong Report From iPhone Chip Supplier

snippet: Shares of Twitter slumped 9 percent late on Wednesday after Recode reported that Google, owned by Alphabet, would not move forward with a bid to acquire the social network.

headline.main: Twitter Drops 9 Percent After Report That Google Won't Bid
headline.print_headline: Twitter Drops 9 Percent After Report That Google Won't Bid

snippet: Shares of Twitter slumped 9 percent late on Wednesday after Recode reported that Google, owned by Alphabet, would not move forward with a bid to acquire the social network.

headline.main: Twitter Drops 9 Percent After Report That Google Won't Bid
headline.print_headline: Twitter Drops 9 Percent After Report That Google Won't Bid

snippet: A stabbing attack at a Minnesota mall last month that wounded 10 was premeditated and the attacker, who was fatally shot by an off-duty police officer, showed signs of radicalization, authorities said on Thursday.

headline.main: FBI Says Minnesota Mall Attack Was Premeditated
headline.print_headline: FBI Says Minnesota Mall Attack Was Premeditated

snippet: Leading Taiwanese chip designer MediaTek Inc, said on Thursday it will triple its workforce in India within three years to 1,500 from more than 500 as it expands research and software development as well as customer service operations.

headline.main: Taiwan's MediaTek to Triple India Workforce to 1,500 Within Three Years
headline.print_headline: Taiwan's MediaTek to Triple India Workforce to 1,500 Within Three Years

snippet: China's Lenovo Group Ltd will bring Fujitsu Ltd's personal computer business under its control, allowing the Japanese company to focus on IT services and other businesses, the Nikkei business daily reported on Thursday.

headline.main: Lenovo to Take Over Fujitsu's PC Business: Nikkei
headline.print_headline: Lenovo to Take Over Fujitsu's PC Business: Nikkei

snippet: Yum Brands Inc, owner of KFC and Pizza Hut, blamed tensions over the South China Sea for an unexpected dip in quarterly sales at its established restaurants in China.

headline.main: Yum Blames South China Sea Protests for Dip in China Sales
headline.print_headline: Yum Blames South China Sea Protests for Dip in China Sales

snippet: China's Lenovo Group Ltd is in talks to bring Fujitsu Ltd's personal computer business under its control, allowing the Japanese company to focus on IT services and other businesses, a source with direct knowledge of the talks said.

headline.main: Lenovo in Talks to Take Over Fujitsu's PC Business: Source
headline.print_headline: Lenovo in Talks to Take Over Fujitsu's PC Business: Source

snippet: Heated meetings, sacrificed holidays and teams monitoring social media round-the-clock to track whether there have been any new smartphone fires: Samsung Electronics is still desperately trying to limit the damage of a record global recall announc...

headline.main: Fighting Fires: Samsung Struggles to Limit Damage From Smartphone Recall
headline.print_headline: Fighting Fires: Samsung Struggles to Limit Damage From Smartphone Recall

snippet: South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co expects third-quarter profit grew 5.6 percent, beating estimates, as a pickup in chip and display earnings likely offset the impact of a global smartphone recall that has roiled the tech giant.

headline.main: Samsung Sees Third Quarter Profit Jump as Chip Surge Eases Smartphone Recall Blues
headline.print_headline: Samsung Sees Third Quarter Profit Jump as Chip Surge Eases Smartphone Recall Blues
